data.title: Restore Viewport::set_world_2d() functionality (2D Split Screen)
data.body:
The official documentation (http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/tutorials/engine/viewports.html) says:

`For 2D, each Viewport always contains it’s own World2D. This suffices in most cases, but in case sharing them may be desired, it is possible to do so by calling the viewport API manually.`

Sadly, the code for it was disabled (and outdated).
This patch restore the functionality allowing viewports to share World2D and easily allowing 2D split screen games.

See the demo project here: https://github.com/Faless/viewport2d-test
Screenshot: 
![viewport2d_demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1687918/18511719/b6c8a21e-7a85-11e6-8757-d90ba228e91b.png)

data.title: Comma key listed as "Colon".
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 
Any? I'm using the fixnum build from Sept 12th. 64-bit Win 7. 

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The comma key shows up as "Colon" in the input map, or from `OS.get_scancode_string`. 

I thought at first this might be some weird keyboard layout thing, but I couldn't find any other keys that have the wrong name associated with them. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Project Settings >> Input Map >> Add a new "Key" event to any action and press the comma key, it will say "Colon" instead.

data.title: AssetLib causes Godot Engine to lag-freeze when using a slow internet speed
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
v2.2.alpha.custom_build

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Using a slow internet connection appears to make Godot Engine freeze and lag while it attempts to fetch plugins. Note that these are assumptions based on what is going on.
This happens every time I do it. Internet speed is around 5-50kb/s and can be up to around 200kb/s on rare occasions.

Another issue is when I click away from AssetLib; it does not stop attempting to download the assetlib. Not a big deal, but can be a pain when you accidentally press AssetLib due to lag/freezes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Have slow internet connection
- Start Godot Engine v2.2 alpha.custom_build
- Select AssetLib 
- (Optional) Unselect AssetLib

---

I could not find any previous issues mentioning about this.

data.title: Securing code/Export encryption key revamp
data.body:
Currently the only way to encrypt Godot scripts is using the export encryption key by recompiling the entire Godit tool chain.  Recompiling everything seems a bit crazy just to secure one's scripts.  

Instead of recompiling the entire tool chain maybe Godot can create a small binary driver and hide a key in there. This binary driver can then be used to run unencrypt the script and start the app.

data.title: [feature request] Godot Editor - Android port
data.body:
From a correspondence on twitter:

> todor imreorov ‏@blurymind  16h16 hours ago
> @reduzio can godot editor run on #android to develop games on mobile like #love2d  can? Would love to have it on my galaxy tab :D 
> 
> Juan Linietsky ‏@reduzio  14h14 hours ago
> @blurymind would not be difficult to do, but not a priority for the main devs. If anyone wants to contribute this work be welcome.

Basically Godot can compile games to android, but the actual editor doesnt have a port yet.
With the rise of android based tablets, I see more and more people use their tablet with a keyboard for work.
As an owner of an android galaxy note 10.1 and someone who spends 4 hours travelling on the train every work day, I started contemplating using that time to do some coding.

Unfortunately there are not many options at the moment, because most game engines have a huge footprint. The only I found that works well is Love2d, but to develop for it you dont have nice things such as code autocompletion on android.
https://love2d.org/

I think that having the editor also work on mobile devices would be a great way to take advantage of it's small footprint and bring to those platforms something that is currently not very available for them.

@reduz  says it's not difficult to do, and work would be welcome.

So who is interested in doing a port, what would the possible technical issues of such port be?

data.title: Engine for General Computing
data.body: There definitely more application in GoDot than gaming. One area is visual scripting like in [LabView](http://www.ni.com/labview/).

data.title: Area enter shape signal, weird parameters
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Windows 10 - Godot Version 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When connecting Area2D signal, "area enter shape", it generates this line of code

func _on_Area2D_area_enter_shape( area_id, area, area_shape, area_shape ):

Notice the last two parameters, they have identical name. Plus, the code works... duplicated parameter's name should throw an syntax error message IMO

**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a Node2D with a script attached. Put Inside an Area2D. Connect signal, area_enter_shape to Node2D script. Look the generated code.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
![ccc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15801379/18498205/2564bd14-7a0b-11e6-865d-c0ccbf175955.png)

data.title: Improve debug focus behavior
data.body:
Fix focusing debugged game on Windows
Add re-focusing editor on continue

In Windows it's a bit convoluted letting one process moving another one's window to the foreground. It requires explicit authorization and it must be renewed.

So I've made both the parent and child process authorize each other so it's possible both focusing the editor on breakpoint and re-focusing the game on continue. The game being debugged must know the editor PID to authorize it so I've created a new parameter `-epid`.

(Fixes #6478.)

data.title: Let editor get focus on breakpoint hit
data.body: This is a usability feature request.

data.title: Sprite/Image/Texture Editor/Creator
data.body:
So as an artist who also uses godot to work on games, i found it rather time consuming having to back and forth between a sprite editor and have to export all the time and such, So i came up with a rather rough mockup for a sprite editor, i dont know how to Code or anything as im mainly an artist, so any feedback on my idea would be helpful

![godot engine - platformer - player tscn - _00029](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13949321/18490191/91a21246-79c6-11e6-9374-755db680cbdb.png)

data.title: Function to get the readable names of gamepad buttons (and vice versa)
data.body:
**Feature Request:**
It would be awesome if there were built-in functions to get a user-readable name of a gamepad/joystick button from its button_index, and vice versa. This functionality already exists for keyboard keys with `OS.get_scancode_string()` and `OS.find_scancode_from_string()`. Functions to get the names of joystick axes would be cool too. 

There are already [global constants](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_@global%20scope.html?highlight=JOY_) that match up joystick axis and button names with their button indices, but they're not terribly useful on their own.

data.title: is_network_master and NETWORK_MODE_INHERIT
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Debian testing, Godot 2.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

```
NodeA            <-- master
|____> NodeB     <---inherit
```

NodeB.is_network_master() returns false. I think it should return true.

**Steps to reproduce:**

This code fails:

```
set_network_mode(NETWORK_MODE_MASTER)
assert(get_node("son").is_network_master())
```

data.title: Physics doesn't factor in scale
data.body:

Changing the scale of an object that uses Rigidbody2D resets the scale at run-time. 

**Steps to reproduce:**

Attach a sprite for visual feedback (or print `get_scale()`)

Run the game

data.title: Strange movement with move_and_slide()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Xubuntu Linux 16.04, v2.2.alpha.custom_build, compiled from source.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I'm putting these issues as one as they are similar enough that I don't want to bombard the issue tracker with issues.

1) The character will "jump" up a little when moving upwards on a ramp when I let go of the movement key.
2) The character will "jump" a little bit when running against a wall while standing on a incline. Similar to problem 1.
3) If there is a moving platform that is shaped as a triangle, and the character is jumping from the bottom and in the same direction as the triangle platform and hits one of the edges while doing so, he will travel vertically upwards with the ramp edge, whereas he should simply fall down. (Also shown in video.)
![temp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20325471/18448023/cdf54084-78ee-11e6-924d-3a7b388c6b70.png)

Here's a video which explains and shows the issues: https://youtu.be/uFPI2GcmXrQ
The problem/problems I am talking about are from 0:00 to 1:29

**Steps to reproduce:**
Please watch link above.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[moveandslide_example.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/468056/moveandslide_example.zip)

data.title: Text can be pasted into/cut from the TextEdit and LineEdit nodes when set to read-only/not editable.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When setting the TextEdit and LineEdit nodes to read-only/non-editable, they are still allowing text to be pasted into/cut from using the right-click context menu "Cut" and "Paste" instead of preventing it. It appears the TextEdit node also allows Ctrl+V to paste when set to read-only.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add a TextEdit or LineEdit node to the scene
2. Set the TextEdit node to readonly via GDscript, or for the LineEdit uncheck the Editable checkbox in its properties.
3. Copy text from somewhere, then right-click on the text field and choose Paste from the context menu (also Ctrl+V for the TextEdit). Text will be pasted in even though it should not be editable. Text can also be Cut using the right-click context menu.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[TextEditReadOnly.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/467604/TextEditReadOnly.zip)

data.title: Suggestion: "Date/Datetime" class / Calendar Button Node
data.body:
Godot is currently missing a class (or even functions) that allows you to setup your own calendar.

I would like to be able to use a Date/Datetime class to determine number of days in X month and Y year.
Since the days per month every year appear to change arbitrarily, I expect a lot of users may find need of this. 

I know a these classes can be used for a lot more, than to simply print out days and such, so I would also love to see it being worked on for other common purposes. Heck; most, if not all programming languages have a Date class accompanied with an Datetime class. All we have right now is a Dictionary with "day", "hour" and such. :)

I made an question at QA; https://godotengine.org/qa/7923/a-calendar-class-or-feature-i-can-use
where I suggested we also may create an calendar node button, that allows us to simply select a day/month/year from a popup.

data.title: Fix/improve AnimationPlayer blending logic
data.body:
While _playing_ with the `AnimationPlayer` I found animation blending was misbehaving.

I found that it maintains a list of blended animations so it's able to blend on top of another blend, etc. But the current logic for removing finished animations is broken IMO as it can remove animations still not finished and keep finished animations pointlessly in the list. Also the interpolation weight is out-of-phase as I understand the code. (Maybe if I managed to understood how those two aspects work together I could see the rationale behind the current code, but still it works unnaturally for me,)

So my proposal changes both things: it applies the current animation as it is defined (weight of 1) and then applies each animation in the stack in reverse order to give the most predictable and natural results. It will remove the animations from the stack if and only if their blend time has finished.

For example, at one point the animation stack could contain something like this after some character has jumped:
Jump (0.2 s left)
Land (0.3 s left)
Stand (current)

The current implementation would remove both _Jump_ and _Land_ as soon as jump blend time is up, which I think is wrong. My proposal would just remove _Jump_ and keep `Land` with it's remaining blend time of 0.1 s.

_This change could break some projects. But if it's considered good, I could add a mode setting which would default to the current behavior so it could be merged safely._

data.title: Scene Hierarchy Panel cropped when selecting a Tilemap Node
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Macbook Pro Retina 13 - El Capitain 10.11.6
Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When selecting a Tilemap node, the Scene view splits into 2 panels: 1 to select the tile and 1 to show the scene. Creating this Tiles Panel 'pushes' the Scene Hierarchy Panel (along with Inspector Panel) to the right, off-screen. Also, I can't resize back to what it was, like the tilemap editor has a minimum width that it has to respect.

It's expected not to be pushed / resized and be able to resize the panel.

I've took a screenshot to show how it looks on my notebook:
http://imgur.com/CUJfu1O

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open any project with a Tilemap and select the Tilemap node.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
I'm using the Kinematic Character Demo

data.title: Inverse Kinematics feature "Pole Target"
data.body:
Would be great if IK Node supported "Pole Target" Spatial node that tells IK Solver in which direction it should bend.

Blender IK Constraint can be used for reference.

data.title: EditorPlugin: no way to know when the current object is deselected
data.body:
Godot 2.1:

I see there is an edit() callback in EditorPlugin, however it is only called when the handled object is selected. When something else gets selected there is no event. I thought edit() would be called with null, but it isn't.

So far I also relied on the Selection object, and it worked pretty well for nodes, so I can hide my editor panel depending on that.

But now I realize it's not great, because you can edit something that is not a node, a shader for example: https://github.com/Zylann/godot_terrain_plugin/issues/8
![Screenshot](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/6a6854ad5edd157dcfb4830d52bd1510548a755e/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f546a6a3978434a2e706e67)

How do I tell my panel to hide in this case?
Doing that in handles() is not appropriate, as it's a testing function, it's not meant to do any action.
I would expect edit() to be called with a null argument, or have a stop_edit() callback.
If all of this is intented, then maybe the panels should be stacked, but I don't think it makes sense.
Finally, if there is already a way to do that, please let me know.

data.title: Inverse Kinematics gets wild when Speed param is above 1 [+test file]
data.body:
I've made simple rig to test InverseKinematics node.

Changed params:
- Iterations to 1 (default 100 was insanely slow, probably should be changed)
- Speed to 2 (default 0.2)

Problem exists on Ik Bone, when Speed is above 1 it starts to shake a lot.

Test file: 
[IK_Demo.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/466222/IK_Demo.zip)

PS
Other noticed problems is that Skeleton Node doesn't display last bone in chain but I will add separate issue for that.
